sectr: Public Administration, Law, and Justice,Health and other social services
trustfund: TF022962-POPULATION PROJECT,TF025150-POPULATION PROJECT,TF022960-DUTCH GRANT TO NIGER
theme: Administrative and civil service reform,Population and reproductive health,Nutrition and food security

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Population Projectz in Niger. The
            project was designed to assist the Government in
            implementing an effective national population program, with
            the primary objective of accelerating the onset of fertility
            decline by increasing the contraceptive prevalence rate as
            rapidly as possible, reducing maternal mortality, promoting
            attitudes favoring a reduction in family size norms, and
            enhancing the capacity of women to participate effectively
            in socioeconomic development. Bank's performance was
            deficient. Borrower's performance was not satisfactory.
            The key lessons learned were as follows: (i) it is necessary
            to include the beneficiaries and agents in the design and
            management of the project; (ii) performance and impact
            indicators should be established at the beginning of the
            project, and monitored on a regular basis; (iii) training
            programs should include a monitoring and evaluation plan;
            (iv) decentralization rnust take into account the following:
            operationalization of the current structure, management
            decentralization, and training; (v) donors must be more
            flexible and adaptable to the context and capacity of the
            structures responsible for project implementation; (vi) an
            appropriate maintenance plan is necessary to ensure
            longevity of equipment and materials; (vii) project
            Coordination Units should be have appropriate technical
            competencies; and (viii) project actions must be coherent in
            order to improve efficiency and impact.
